newsitem.title: TAIWAN: PRESS DIGEST - Taiwan newspapers - April 18.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Taiwan newspapers - April 18.

text.p: These are the leading stories in the Taiwan press on Friday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
CHINA TIMES - President Lee Teng-hui tells Japanese journalists he will not run for another term in office
Taiwan to fully liberalise financial, commodities market in three years
UNITED DAILY NEWS - First Taiwan ship set to sail directly to (mainland China port of) Xiamen on April 24
President Lee Teng-hui cautions against large investment in China
LIBERTY TIMES - President Lee Teng-hui once again calls on China to reopen talks with Taiwan
China approves six Taiwan firms to operate cross-strait shipping
COMMERCIAL TIMES - China approves Taiwan shippers to sail across Taiwan strait; move expected to cut costs by up to US$150 per container
Cabinet Development Fund loses money in reinvestment projects
ECONOMIC DAILY NEWS - Taiwan to dispatch first ship to China's Xiamen on April 24, China to do the same (to Taiwan) in near term
Parliament to vote on whether to grant three-month grace period during which investors could disclose and register their unauthorised activities in China
